courses.title: Fundamentals of Design and the Built Environment I
courses.description: Introduction to creative problem-solving and the design realization cycle through project-based design exercises that emphasize the role of representation.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Design and the Built Environment II
courses.description: Introduction to the design of complex problems through an emphasis on integrative and collaborative design strategies, research, critical reflection, and interdisciplinary team work.

courses.title: Introduction to Design and the Built Environment
courses.description: Introduction to architecture, building construction, and industrial design through case studies that illuminate past and present practices, as well as future possibilities within the disciplines.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Furniture Workshop: Material Potential and Fabrication Strategies
courses.description: The course investigates construction into the design cycle to explore the boundaries between furniture, architecture, and sculpture. Exercises introduce furniture production techniques, material properties, and CNC milling.

courses.title: History of Construction Industry
courses.description: Addresses how today's construction industry is organized and its particular characteristics, how it evolved from early times and where it may be heading in the future.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics in design and the built environment.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics in design and the built environment.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics in design and the built environment.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics in design and the built environment.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics in design and the built environment.

courses.title: History of Construction Industry
courses.description: Addresses how today's construction industry is organized and its particular characteristics, how it evolved from early times and where it may be heading in the future.

courses.title: Urban Design Laboratory
courses.description: Urban design laboratory problems focusing on analysis, design, and implementation strategies for contemporary urban problems.

courses.title: Art and Architecture in Classical Greece
courses.description: An intensive on-site investigation of the role that the arts and architecture have played in the development of classical Greek civilization.

courses.title: Art and Architecture in Italy I
courses.description: Investigations of the painting, sculpture, and architecture of the Classical, Early Christian, Byzantine, and Medieval periods in Italy with special emphasis on Rome.

courses.title: Art and Architecture in Italy II
courses.description: Investigations of the painting, sculpture, and architecture of the Renaissance and Baroque periods in Italy with special emphasis on the works of Rome.

courses.title: Retrofitting the Suburbia
courses.description: Study of suburban redevelopment trends, projects, and policies that improve environmental, social, and economic sustainability, with an emphasis on urban design strategies.

courses.title: History of Urban Form
courses.description: History of the city as a collective work of architecture with an emphasis on the city's physical form and space.  Credit not allowed for both COA 6151 and ARCH 4151.

courses.title: Design of Design Environments
courses.description: Analysis of design processes; analysis of current design tools at both the user interface and functional levels; procedures for developing better design tools.  Credit not allowed for both COA 6763 and ID 6763 or CS 6763.

courses.title: Geometric Modeling
courses.description: Software development course focusing on 3D geometric constructions and modeling;  emphasizes solid modeling and its role in design.  Crosslisted with CS 6764.

courses.title: Urban Design Studio I
courses.description: Advanced urban design problems emphasizing the application of contemporary urban design research and multidisciplinary collaboration into the design process.

courses.title: Urban Design Studio II
courses.description: Advanced urban design problems emphasizing the application of contemporary urban design research and multidisciplinary collaboration into the design process.

courses.title: PhD Planning Seminar
courses.description: Discussion of research and pedagogy topics and methodologies for city and regional planning.

courses.title: The Genesis of Architecture
courses.description: The nature of architecture illustrated from those of all cultures; determinist theories; its social values and its meanings to the individual- material, physical, anthropological, and cognitive.

courses.title: Thought and Interpretation in Architecture from the Hellenic Period to the 1830's
courses.description: A survey of architectural thought and theory taking account of other fields; paralleled by a review of major critical texts and assessments to the present day.

courses.title: Thought and Interpretation in Architecture from the 1830's to the Twentieth Century
courses.description: A survey of architectural thoughts and theory taking account other fields; paralleled by a review of major critical texts and assessments to the present day.

courses.title: The Design and Evolution of American Space
courses.description: Topical seminar on the development of urban, suburban, and rural American spatial forms, with emphasis on the relationship between public order and vernacular settlement.

courses.title: Theories of Inquiry in Architecture
courses.description: Introduction to research paradigms and their assumptions. The formulation of questions and frameworks of description, representation, analysis, interpretation, and data control.

courses.title: Theories of Architecture, Space and Culture
courses.description: Accounts of the social functions of architectural space and associated design choices, across a variety of building types and scales of environmental design. Credit will not be awarded for both COA 8630 and ARCH 4630.

courses.title: Architecture and Policy:  Linking Theory and Practice
courses.description: Methods and theories of planning, design, facilities management, and evaluation as they relate to organizational policy and development.

courses.title: Theories of Psychology for Architecture
courses.description: An examination of social and psychological theory as it is applied to the creation and use of space.

courses.title: Analytical Models of Built Space and Its Functions
courses.description: Introduction to analytical ideas and methodologies for the quantitative description of built space, form, building use, and functions.  Layouts as configurations: boundaries, accessibility, visibility, extensions.

courses.title: Formal Descriptions of Designs: Analyses of Space, Shape, and Form
courses.description: Introduction to the form and computational description of designs, with an emphasis on spatial patterns. Geometrical constructions, combinatorial approaches, analyses of shape.

courses.title: Research Seminar in Design Computation
courses.description: Seminar review of developments in computing applied to architecture; current major research issues.

courses.title: Structuring Multimedia Design Knowledge
courses.description: Theories and tools for structuring multimedia knowledge for design and designers.

courses.title: Design and Engineering Databases
courses.description: Survey of database use in design and engineering; surveys relational, object-oriented database technology, and ISO-STEP methods of integration.

courses.title: Performance Aspects of Building Systems Design
courses.description: Engineering analysis of building (sub) systems based on a performance ontology.  Criteria, metrics, and tools for performance aspect evaluations in different building technology domains.

courses.title: Computational Building Simulation
courses.description: Numerical simulation of performance characteristics of whole buildings.  Review of the finite element method for uniform treatment of transport phenomena in different building technology domains.

courses.title: Integrated Design and Engineering Environments for Buildings
courses.description: Surveys of issues for effective integration of heterogeneous design tools for building; previous efforts, current approaches; advanced techniques, including ISO-STEP and IAI.
